result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Allen A Flowers

records.addlTxt:
9:01 AM Prosecuting attorney Barry J Braatz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Allen A Flowers in court, in custody. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defendant does not have an attorney yet.  Defendant needs more time to retain counsel/time for SPD to appoint counsel. 
BTC: Finding of good cause of waive time limits.
Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on September 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
defendant is eligible for SPD, no attorney appointment as of today due to insufficient time to appoint counsel

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Do not drive at all. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

2:20 PM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Allen A Flowers appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Natalie Probst appeared by video for Allen A Flowers. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Initial appearance on August 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
